content: The activated MOF materials MFM-300­(X) (X = Al, Fe, In, or Sc) were synthesized as reported elsewhere. In a 10 mL glass vial, 25 mg of MFM-300­(X) and 2.5 mL acetone were added. The mixture was sealed and stirred vigorously for 30 minutes, after which 25 μL was pipetted onto the active area of the IDE. The IDE was allowed to dry at room temperature for 10 min, followed by vacuum drying at 175 °C and <1 mTorr for 8 h. To determine the deposition amount, the mass of the IDE was monitored after each step in this process using a calibrated, high-resolution balance (Mettler Toledo XS105). Across all samples, an average of 1.52 ± 0.21 mg (N = 16) MFM-300­(X) was deposited onto an IDE.
clean_text: The activated MOF materials MFM-300(X) (X = Al, Fe, In, or Sc) were synthesized as reported elsewhere. In a 10 mL glass vial, 25 mg of MFM-300(X) and 2.5 mL acetone were added. The mixture was sealed and stirred vigorously for 30 minutes, after which 25 μL was pipetted onto the active area of the IDE. The IDE was allowed to dry at room temperature for 10 min, followed by vacuum drying at 175 °C and <1 mTorr for 8 h. To determine the deposition amount, the mass of the IDE was monitored after each step in this process using a calibrated, high-resolution balance (Mettler Toledo XS105). Across all samples, an average of 1.52 ± 0.21 mg (N = 16) MFM-300(X) was deposited onto an IDE.
